entry.title: How to implement parallel processing on a join function in an SAP PaPM on premise environment

How can we do the same for a standard PaPM join function or allocation function? Marking these join function and allocation function with the partition that we create in the environment does not work. Please advise, if anyone has any experience in it

entry.title: IAS service binding auto-rotates X.509
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are using IAS with a Cloud Foundry application, and we provision IAS users through the User Management REST API https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/user-management-rest-api.

Our IAS instance allows X.509 credentials, and the application uses the X.509 certificate automatically generated in the service binding.

During deployment, Cloud Foundry recreates the binding, and we consistently observe the following:

Behaviour

Every time the service binding is recreated, IAS issues a new X.509 certificate, even when the previous one has not expired.

When the certificate is rotated, IAS automatically disables “API Access for application users”, and the User Management REST API stops working until we manually re-enable it.

The certificate rotation and permission toggle happen even if nothing in the IAS configuration changed.

Questions

Is this the expected behaviour in IAS/Cloud Foundry? Does IAS always regenerate a new X.509 credential whenever a CF binding is recreated?

If this is expected, what is the recommended way to avoid breaking the User Management REST API during deployments? Should we avoid certificate-based credentials for apps that use the User Management API?

Goal

We want to prevent situations where the User Management REST API suddenly stops working after a deployment.

Any guidance, recommended patterns, or confirmations of expected behaviour would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Unallocated Gender in WFA (Drill to detail)
entry.content:
Hi @Lola_Alao - in Personal Information table, which field did you setup as primary/secondary person?  For this table, we can only use Person ID and setup as secondary person ID.  Even though there is a User Sys ID field in this table but most of the time, this field is empty.

If you use Users Sys ID field from this table, that's maybe why not all records mapped to corresponding Gender value.

entry.title: Re: Asset Management for Resource Scheduling - External availabilities (Rostering)
entry.content:
Hi Tim,

Thanks for the excellent blog — it has been extremely helpful while we’ve been working through this scenario for a customer.

We now have the SuccessFactors → S/4 workforce-availability integration configured and running, and we can see failed messages in Message Dashboard when they occur. However, we’re having difficulty proving that successful messages actually update the availability data inside S/4, and would appreciate some guidance.

1. CDS Views for Verifying Inbound Data

Is there a CDS view you recommend for confirming that the incoming availability data has been written correctly?

I’ve found I_PERSONWORKAGRMTPLNDWRKGTIME, but I’m not confident this is the correct data source for the Resource Scheduling / People Gantt scenario. I also understand this may reflect MDI-replicated data rather than the Workforce Availability API dataset.

If there is a definitive CDS view that Resource Scheduling consumes, that would be extremely helpful.

2. No Visibility of Successful Replication

We can view failed messages in Message Dashboard, but we cannot see any details for successful Workforce Availability messages. Is there a standard app or monitoring point where successful writes can be confirmed?

3. People Gantt – Still Showing Dark Grey Only

We’ve created Work Centre Teams based on individuals we can locate in the CDS view, but when we open the People Gantt via the Maintenance Scheduling Board, we still only see the “all dark grey” background — not the white availability blocks shown in your “Final Result”.

This suggests the data may not be landing in the table or structure that People Gantt actually reads from.

4. API Test – GET Returns Zero Records

Following your blog, a colleague performed a direct API test to validate the inbound side:

  • Communication Arrangement: SAP_COM_0301

  • Using Postman:
    GET https://<tenant>-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/opu/odata/SHCM/API_MANAGE_WF_AVAILABILITY/TimeOverviewSet

The call succeeds (200 OK), but returns no records.

In your blog example you are performing a POST to create availability records.
We are attempting a GET to read existing records — and getting an empty feed.

This raises the question:
Should successful SF → S/4 integration runs populate TimeOverviewSet, or does People Gantt read from a different underlying structure?

Any advice you can offer — particularly around which internal tables/CDS views should contain the written availability data — would be hugely appreciated.

Thank you again for sharing such a practical walkthrough. It has been invaluable in helping us progress this integration.

entry.title: How to create Substitution for Profit Center in Journal Entry Item
entry.content:
Dear SAP.

We like to write the substitution for profit center. But in the app "Manage substitution & Validation rules", Business context - Journal entry item, Profit center is not available as "substitution target field".

Please share the SAP note or the process to extend the field.

Thanks.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to create Substitution for Profit Center in Journ...
entry.content:
Hi,

There are a few options for you to create Substitution for Profit Center in Journal Entry currently:

  • If the substitution logic is simple, you can create a substitution rule in Manage Substitution & Validation Rules under Business Context - Market Segment. Please refer to SAP Help Page Substitution/Validation for Market Segments for general information on Market Segments, as well as Rules for Substitution for the list of available fields.
  • If the substitution logic is more complex, you can create a BAdI Implementation in Custom Logic app for BAdI FINS_CODING_BLOCK or FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_SUBSTITUTION, depend on the business transaction you would like to substitute Profit Center in. The sample code of each BAdI (Use case 02 for FINS_CODING_BLOCK and Use case 06 for FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_SUBSTITUTION) provide some example on how to do substitution on Profit center. 

Regards,

An.

entry.title: Recap SAP TechEd 2025: Discover, manage and control all your AI agents
entry.content:
Last week, we announced the general availability of the AI agent hub in SAP LeanIX. All existing customers can start discovering their agents from Microsoft, Google, and SAP immediately, or begin sending agent cards via the API. Detailed documentation can be found here. 


Below you find a recap of the most frequently asked questions. In case you missed the session, you can rewatch it here. 

  1. What is the AI agent hub all about?
    AI agent discovery is available now to all SAP LeanIX customers as part of the standard APM solution. For enterprise architects responsible for application landscapes, integrations, and governance, this capability provides a centralized, discoverable inventory of AI agents across cloud platforms and custom sources.
  2. When is it available?
    Availability: The feature is live and included in the standard APM module for SAP LeanIX customers.
    Documentation: Detailed setup and connector guidance is published on the SAP Help Portal | SAP Online Help. Read the documentation first for step-by-step configuration and supported connector behavior.
  3. How AI agents are discovered?
    LeanIX integrates natively with platform connectors. The Microsoft connector surfaces agents built on Microsoft cloud services (Azure AI Foundry, Copilot). The Google integration follows the same model with a current focus on agents configured on Google Agent Engine. The SAP integration captures used preconfigured Joule agents.
    If your agents are not built on Microsoft, Google, or SAP, you can still send them to LeanIX by sending agent metadata via the AI Agent API.
  4. What is the focus of the AI agent hub?
    LeanIX is a discovery and governance layer. It does not execute or orchestrate agents; it provides visibility and governance controls rather than runtime management.
  5. How are agents modelled in SAP LeanIX?
    AI Agents are modeled as a subtype of the Application Fact Sheet. This design supports joint application landscapes, incl. agents and data flows, while enabling agent-specific typing and conditional fields for clarity in the UI.
  6. How do you calculate an agent's business value?
    LeanIX provides a built-in, documented calculation to estimate the business impact of custom agents. This calculation is adaptable to your organization’s criteria and needs. 
  7. What are the SAP solution suggestions all about? 
    With the SAP solution suggestions you get a curated view in the context of your application landscape on which SAP AI agents and applications you are not yet using while having the technical set up in place.
  8. What is the commercial impact of the AI agent hub? 
    AI Agents are commercially relevant and treated as an Application subtype; they are licensed as discounted applications at a 1:5 ratio (apps : agents). The overall licensing approach remains application-based.
  9. What's next? 
    We focus on building integrations with major agent building platforms and discovering MCP servers to enable more comprehensive modeling of how agents, applications, and MCP servers are connected in your application landscape.

entry.title: Re: IE4N with EWM
entry.content:
IE4N is not Supported with EWM Storage location. 

You need to dismantle the Equipment from it's superior equipment or functional location and change it's valuation (C1 to C3 ie. "New" to "Damaged") in IE02. 

Now add the damaged material in component tab with it's Batch (valuation ie. "Damaged") with quantity -1 (negative). 

While doing MIGO specify the serial no. of the damaged material. 

When you post the document it will generate a Inbound delivery.

entry.title: Re: intercompany stock transfer with consignment
entry.content:
Dear @nevin_philip,

When the stock is send from company B to Company A and to transfer the goods ownership from Company A to Company B follow the Advanced Intercompany stock transfer with Value chain monitoring.

Where the Advanced intercompany will follow the below:
Customer places order --> Company A --> company A sends order to Company B --> Company B --> posts the stock to Stock in transit based on the incoterms --> Once stock is received in Company A --> PGR is done which moves the stock ownership to company A from stock in transit.

This make the ownership to transfer to company A only after the goods is receoved in company A.
Hope this helps!!!

Best Regards,
Surya.

entry.title: Streamlining Data with SAP CPI Message Mapping: Sorting Employees & Eliminating Incomplete Records
entry.content:
Introduction:

When it comes to enterprise integration—especially using SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI)—managing employee data effectively is more than just a backend task. It’s essential for keeping HR systems clean, reliable, and ready to support business operations.

Whether you're syncing employee records across platforms or preparing data for payroll, accuracy and consistency are non-negotiable. In this post, we’ll explore a hands-on use case where we transform employee data using Message Mapping in SAP CPI. From filtering out incomplete entries to sorting and mapping key fields, each step is designed to improve data quality and make downstream processes smoother and more efficient.

Requirement Overview:

Here’s what we needed to achieve:

  1. Sort employee data in descending order by EmployeeID
  2. Remove records where EmployeeID is missing
  3. Map only valid employee records
  4. Preserve and map other employee details like FirstName, LastName, Department, Position, Manager ID, and Salary

Step-by-Step Solution:

1.Mapping Employees to Employees
  Connect the source Employees node to the target Employees node — the base for all transformations.

 

 



2.Filtering Records Without EmployeeID
  1.Apply a conditional mapping expression or standard function to validate EmployeeID.  
  2.Use `removeContext` + filtering logic to drop entries without IDs.

 



3. Node Creation Based on EmployeeID
  1. For each valid employee, create the target Employee node.  
  2.Map EmployeeID from `/Employees/Employee/EmployeeID`.

4.Sorting Employee Data
  1.Use `sortByKey` or `sort` functions to arrange employees in ascending or descending order.  
  2.Output is structured for easy downstream consumption.

 



5. Mapping Remaining Fields
  Map FirstName, LastName, Department, Position, ManagerID, Salary for valid records.

6.

 

7.Conclusion

 

Transforming employee data in SAP CPI using Message Mapping is more than just a technical task—it’s a strategic move to ensure clean, efficient, and reliable business processes.

By using functions like removeContext, sortByKey, and conditional expressions, we make sure that only valid and well-structured records flow through the system. This not only improves data quality but also enhances downstream HR and payroll operations.

Whether you're working with large datasets or customizing logic for evolving business needs, mastering these mapping techniques empowers you to build scalable and intelligent integrations. Always test thoroughly, simulate edge cases, and refine your logic to stay ahead in dynamic enterprise environments.

 

 

 



->Best Practices & Functions Used
  1.'removeContext' – Flatten & isolate unique entries  
  2. 'splitByValue' – Advanced filtering scenarios  
  3.'sortByKey' / 'sort' – Order employees as required  
  4. Mapping Expressions – Dynamic filtering & path-based mapping

->Business Benefits
   1. Data Quality – Only valid records flow through  
   2. Efficiency – Clean, sorted data improves HR/payroll workflows  
   3.Flexibility – Logic can adapt to evolving needs (sort by Salary, Dept, etc.)

entry.title: Re: intercompany stock transfer with consignment
entry.content: No, in standard SAP you cannot directly trigger a consignment STO from a sales order. Sales orders can trigger purchase requisitions or third‑party procurement flows, but consignment stock transfer orders are not automatically created from sales orders. You would need to configure a separate STO process or use enhancements/custom development to link the two.

entry.title: Updated Learning Offering for Product Compliance
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA for product compliance is designed to empower businesses with capabilities that simplify compliance management. We will explore its key features, such as Compliance Data Foundation, Product Marketability, Safety Data Sheet Management, and Dangerous Goods Management. These functionalities not only ensure adherence to regulations but also integrate seamlessly with business operations, providing a comprehensive view of compliance across the product lifecycle. By leveraging these tools, companies can mitigate risks, reduce compliance costs, and maintain a competitive edge in the market.

 

Highlights:

  • The course is open to everyone
  • The course is free
  • Understand how product compliance integrates into many different business roles
  • Understand key aspects of the 3 core solution areas (Product Marketability, Dangerous Goods, Safety Data Sheets)

 

For professionals seeking to advance their careers, expertise in product compliance is increasingly valuable. As companies expand globally, they require skilled individuals who can navigate the intricate web of international regulations and standards. This expertise can open doors to roles in regulatory affairs, quality assurance, and corporate strategy, among others. Additionally, with the advent of digital tools and platforms like SAP S/4HANA, professionals can leverage technology to enhance compliance processes, making them more efficient and integrated. By learning about product compliance, professionals not only safeguard their organizations but also position themselves as indispensable assets in the global marketplace.

Here is a link to the learning journey and coming soon is the next part of the product compliance learning journey, a specific learning on dangerous goods.

entry.title: Re: Staging Job not working - All staging proposal quanti...
entry.content:
Good day @jan_9979 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some references for more details.

Staging of EWM Parts, Staging of EWM Parts, Material Staging (with EWM), Production Material Request Item

Based on your screenshot details, there are a few areas you can check to confirm if the issue is based on settings in your system.

First, can you check if your BOM component staging indicator is set to 2 (which releases Order Part) or 3 (which creates Part)? If not, that might explain why your proposal quantity delivers 0.

Second, make sure you confirm that the component is linked to a Supply Area in the routing. If it is not, then your demand cannot be calculated.

Third, please check if your work center, supply area, EWM staging area is mapped end-to-end. If your staging bin cannot be determined, then your proposal will equal 0.

Fourth, your PMR needs to be ready for staging because only then does the automatic job pick it. Your status seems set to “Not begun” or “Released”, if I understood that correctly, then your proposal will be 0 because staging is not ready.

Finally, ensure your job settings are “Consider PMR demand” and “Propose quantities”.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Resolving Secure Store Decryption Process Error During Solution Manager Java System Migration
entry.content:
Dear Reader,

During a recent migration of a Solution Manager (SolMan) Java system, I encountered a challenging issue that may be helpful for others performing similar migrations. This post summarizes the symptoms, root cause, analysis, and key recommendations to avoid the same pitfalls.

Issue Overview

The migration was planned using the backup/restore method. After restoring the system from the source backup, the following error occurred when attempting to update the UMEBackend connection in the Config Tool:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
com.sap.security.core.server.secstorefs.InvalidStateException: Internal error during the decryption process.

Caused by: javax.crypto.BadPaddingException: Invalid PKCS#5 padding length: 115

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Initial troubleshooting steps included:

  • Copying the security folder, bootstrap directory, and Config Tool from source to target
  • Performing a Homogeneous System Copy using SWPM
  • Changing the keyphrase

However, none of these attempts resolved the issue.

Root Cause Identified

The underlying issue was eventually traced to a SAPJVM version mismatch between the source and target systems:

  • Source: SAPJVM 8.1.096
  • Target: SAPJVM 8.1.063

Once the target SAPJVM was updated to match the source version, the PAS (Primary Application Server) started successfully.

However, the additional application server continued to fail with the following error in the Config Tool:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
software version 7.00.000.001 is incompatible with file version 7.50.000.005

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Deeper Analysis & Final Resolution

A detailed comparison of the encryption algorithms revealed a mismatch in the Secure Store (Secstore.key) configuration of source and target:

--------------------------------------------------

Source: 7.00.000.001 | 3DES 

Target: 7.50.000.005 | AES256
--------------------------------------------------

Attempts to regenerate the secstore.properties and secstore.key files using SAP Note 2126229 did not resolve the issue.

The breakthrough came from SAP Note 3153525 , which explains changes in SecureStoreFS encryption algorithms. After adjusting the encryption algorithm accordingly, the additional application server started successfully.

Key Recommendations for Future Java Migrations

To prevent similar issues, I highly recommend performing the following pre-checks during Java system migrations:

1. Validate SAPJVM Versions

          Ensure that the SAPJVM version on the target system is equal to or newer than the source.
          A mismatch can cause secure store decryption failures.

2. Verify Secure Store Encryption Algorithm Consistency

         Compare the secstore.key files from both systems:

         Path: /usr/sap/<SID>/SYS/global/security/data/Secstore.key

        a. Check the version prefix before the | separator:

      • 7.50.000.005 → AES256
      • 7.50.000.004 → AES128
      • 7.00.000.001 → 3DES

       b. Both systems must use compatible encryption algorithms.
            If they differ, consider re-encryption of secure store or upgrading the system as needed.

Thanks for reading! Feel free to drop comments or questions.

entry.title: Re: Reimagining Certification for the Way We Work Today
entry.content:
@ielqour - I've got a feeling that these issues might have something to do with the scenario where you save your work. They don't tell you where to save your work and I got a list of instructions AFTER the event to make sure all previous browser sessions are closed down properly before attempting the exam (ALL THESE INSTRUCTIONS SHOULD'VE BEEN GIVEN UPFRONT).  If you look in the AI Launchpad testbed now you can see new filtering options. It looks like our work might have gone down a black hole. 

@DianaRoesner  - I've escalated this (and the incorrect instructions in the exam) to our SAP Certs team at my firm. SAP should at least come back with feedback to say, 'You've fundamentally got it wrong',  or a percentage mark (if you got 0%, then you've saved it incorrectly somewhere or saved it as the wrong user due to browser caching issues), but I got this:

'However, at this time, we are unable to provide specific details regarding the sections where you did not meet the passing criteria, nor can we guarantee that we will be able to share granular feedback. We genuinely appreciate your input, and we will certainly use it to inform future system enhancements. Our backend review confirms that the exam attempt was marked as "fail."'

......Which, as I've said previously is unacceptable. EVERY OTHER SAP exam I've taken in past gives you a breakdown of areas where you did better than others, areas where you need to improve. 

They also keep offering for me to retake it the exam, but that's pointless if what you're doing is doomed to fail from the very off!

entry.title: CAP Highlights from TechEd 2025 and Devtoberfest 2025 – a Recap
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

the fall of 2025 was an exciting time: We had two great events - Devtoberfest 2025 and SAP TechEd 2025 – showcasing the latest developments, tools, and best practices in the SAP ecosystem. Let's take a closer look at the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) highlights from each event.

 

CAP @ SAP TechEd 2025: A Commitment to Developers

This year, SAP TechEd was a hybrid event, offering both in-person experiences in Berlin and virtual participation. We hope you had the chance to join us in person, as my colleague Alon Shachar did. He shares his impressions in his blog post “SAP Build introducing intent-based development for Application Development @ SAP TechED”.

As always, the event featured hundreds of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities. This year, developers and their needs were addressed in numerous sessions, with CAP being a prominent part in many of those sessions. For an overview of all the CAP related sessions at SAP TechEd 2025 I recommend reading this blog post. You didn’t have the chance to attend the event in Berlin? You still have the chance to join one of the SAP TechEd on Tour events. And you can watch the recordings that are available for some of the sessions. Find below a summary of the CAP related recordings.

 

Keynote: Developers at the Center

The keynote “Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next” addressed the evolving role of developers in an AI-driven world. It explored how SAP's latest technologies and tools are empowering these roles. We saw many exciting announcements and demos. My colleague Friederike Marby, for example, gave a great demo showcasing how to build an intelligent CAP application through intent-based development using SAP Build. You missed it? Here is the link to the recording: Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next.

 

Strategy Talk: AI-Assisted Developer Tools

The strategy talk “SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools” highlighted latest innovations in SAP Build solutions.  In this session, my colleagues Alon Shachar and Ole Lilienthal showcased how AI-assisted tools and enhancements are enabling developers to create extensions and applications more efficiently. With in-depth CAP demos Ole and Alon presented, how these tools are designed to help developers and partners build at scale, with AI as a co-pilot rather than a replacement. I highly recommend you to watch the session: SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools.

 

Roadmap Session: Clean Core and Extensibility

In the roadmap session "Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying Clean Core & LoB extensions" Alon Shachar and Ole Lilienthal were telling us how SAP Build is evolving into a unified AI enabled platform built to extend our ecosystem. Attendees were introduced to the roadmap highlights across application development in SAP Build solutions, including updates for the Joule copilot, CAP, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps. These advancements aim to boost productivity and support the clean core concept and extensibility for line-of-business apps.

 

Devtoberfest 2025: CAP in the Spotlight

Devtoberfest is always a great opportunity to get ready for SAP TechEd. Devtoberfest 2025 continued its tradition as a virtual, community-driven event. This year, Fridays were dedicated to CAP, with a strong lineup of sessions that balanced practical enablement, new features, and forward-looking demos.

You were not able to take part? No worries – all sessions have been recorded: From building enterprise grade CAP applications to integrating AI into CAP application development and exploring new tools: here's what developers learned in the various CAP related sessions.

 

Building Enterprise Grade CAP applications using BTP Developer's guide

This session focused on enhancing CAP applications with enterprise grade capabilities. Key features discussed included audit logging, change tracking, attachments, and multitenancy. These capabilities are crucial for making applications robust and scalable. The session also highlighted the importance of following the best practices described in the SAP BTP Developer's Guide to achieve these enhancements.

 

Get to know more about CAP’s documentation offering

Documentation is a vital resource for developers, and this session provided insights into CAP's documentation offerings. Attendees learned how to provide feedback, work effectively with sample projects, and contribute to improving the CAP documentation. The session emphasized the collaborative nature of the CAP community and how developers can help enhance the learning experience for others.

 

Integrating S/4HANA Public Cloud APIs into CAP Made Simple

This session was demonstrating that integrating SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition APIs into CAP projects can be simple. Attendees gained guidance on authentication, service consumption, and best practices for scalability and maintainability, equipping them to accelerate their integration projects.

 

Less code, same logic – reduce your custom handlers by using new CAP features

CAP’s philosophy has always been to minimize boilerplate and repetitive code, e.g. via the built-in handlers for all standard CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) operations. This session introduced new features that further reduce or even eliminate the need for custom handler logic. This not only simplifies code but also reduces maintenance efforts and potential bugs.

 

Status-Transition Flows

This session covered the new Status-Transition Flows capability. This feature allows developers to define status and status-transition flows directly in CDS models using annotations. The required handlers are automatically generated. Developers retain the flexibility to override generated logic when complex scenarios demand custom implementations. This approach offers flexibility while maintaining control over complex scenarios.

 

Taking UI5 Server Side Rendering to the next level with AI

AI is transforming all areas of development, including UI development. This session showcased how you can use AI to automatically generate SAPUI5 views from CAP entity definitions offering a glimpse into the future of dynamic, short-living UIs generated from OData services.

 

CAP Tools – What's New and Hot

The tooling session highlighted latest enhancements in CAP tools. Notable updates included IntelliJ support, new linter checks helping to maintain code quality in custom implementations, and CLI enhancements improving debugging workflows, deployment processes, and REPL (Read Evaluate Print Loop) interactions. These improvements enhance the day-to-day development experience.

 

Best Practices in CAP​

This session provided insights into the effective use of CAP. Daniel Hutzel, the CPO and founder of CAP, shared valuable guidance on both the recommended best practices and common pitfalls to avoid when working with CAP.

 

Testing SAP CAP Node.js apps with cds.test

Testing is critical for reliable applications. The testing session provided comprehensive coverage of automated testing strategies for CAP Node.js applications. Using the cds.test framework, attendees learned how to set up and execute tests for CAP services, focusing on core scenarios such as validating service APIs and handling business logic.

 

SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant - Transforming with Gen AI​

This session introduced an enhanced tool for automating the conversion of service layers from XS Classic or XS Advanced into modern CAP-based services. By leveraging generative AI, developers can accelerate service layer migration to CAP, reducing manual effort and enabling faster cloud-native transformation.

 

Agentic Coding with CAP​

The agentic coding session introduced the new MCP server for CAP, which significantly enhances the capabilities of AI agents by providing them with comprehensive context and relevant examples, effectively transforming them into CAP development experts.

 

Plug'n'Ask: Enabling AI Context in CAP Through the Power of Plugins And MCP

During this session we explored into the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and how it can be integrated into CAP applications through plugins and annotations in CDS definitions. Developers learned how to empower their applications to communicate with LLM clients, providing context for the data within their applications.

 

CAP console​

Participants were introduced to the new CAP console, a native application designed to streamline the deployment and monitoring of CAP applications on SAP BTP. Embracing the grow-as-you-go philosophy, this tool simplifies the initial deployment process and offers robust monitoring features, all from a locally running app. Built by developers for developers, the CAP console allows developers to focus on coding rather than infrastructure challenges.

 

Conclusion

It's exciting to see how CAP continues to evolve, offering new possibilities and simplifying complex tasks. Both Devtoberfest 2025 and SAP TechEd 2025 provided many valuable insights for developers working with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model. From core development practices to AI-powered innovations, the sessions offered a comprehensive look at all the great features of CAP. Whether you attended these events in person or followed along virtually, the shared experiences and learnings will surely inspire your next project.

If you missed any sessions, as mentioned above, all the sessions listed in this blog post are available on demand. It’s worth catching up - there’s a lot to learn. Until next time, keep coding. 😊

entry.title: Tables Exist in ABAP Dictionary but Not in Database
entry.content:
Dear Reader,

During the SWPM (Software Provisioning Manager) export phase, you may encounter situations where certain tables exist in the ABAP Dictionary but not in the database.

This discrepancy can cause export packages to fail, resulting in export errors.

Example Error in Package Log

When such inconsistencies occur, the export log (e.g., <package-name>.log) will contain error messages similar to the following:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A3EEEXP 008 Task failed with error: (EXP) DbSIExeRead failed with dbrc=103

A3EEEXP 008 (EXP) SQL error = 942

A2EETSK 007 Finished export for object "RSJOBMESSAGEHDLR" of type "table" with error in 0.00 sec #

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Identifying Failed Tables

To identify all failed tables within a specific package, open the corresponding <package-name>.TSK file.
Entries for failed tables will typically appear in the following format:

----------------------------------------------

D  RSJOBMESSAGEHDLR E err

----------------------------------------------

Verifying Tables in ABAP Dictionary

Once the failed tables are identified, you can verify their existence in the ABAP Dictionary using transaction SE14.

Resolution

If the table is missing in the database but exists in the ABAP Dictionary, you can create the table.


Once created, rerun the export process for the affected package.

Reverse Scenario

In some cases, the situation may be reversed — tables exist in the database but not in the ABAP Dictionary.
In such cases, these tables are ignored during the export process:

  • They are not included in any .STR file.
  • They are not exported by SWPM.

This behavior is expected and does not require corrective action.

Thanks for reading !! Please feel free to add your thoughts.

entry.title: Resolving SWPM reverse lookup Error When Using a Single IP for Both Virtual and Physical Hostnames
entry.content:
Dear Reader,

In some system landscapes, you may encounter a scenario where a single IP address serves as both the primary (physical) and secondary (virtual) IP. In other words, both the virtual and physical hostnames are mapped to the same IP address.

During the Software Provisioning Manager (SWPM) execution, this setup may lead to a hostname resolution error that prevents you from proceeding with the installation.

Example Error Log from SWPM

This computer's host name is '<Virtual-Hostname>' but a reverse lookup returned '<Physical-Hostname>'. This will lead to problems later on when starting the Web Application Server. SOLUTION: Insert a line: '<IP-address> <Virtual-Hostname>' into the host file '/etc/hosts', and then continue with the installation.

Root Cause

SWPM performs a reverse DNS lookup during the installation process. If both virtual and physical hostnames are associated with the same IP address, the nslookup may return the physical hostname instead of the expected virtual hostname, triggering the above error.

Solution

As suggested in the error message, ensure that the virtual hostname entry is correctly maintained in the /etc/hosts file.

If both the virtual and physical hostnames are defined for the same IP address, the order of entries in the /etc/hosts file becomes crucial.

Make sure that the virtual hostname entry appears before the physical hostname entry, as shown below:

<IP-address> <Virtual-Hostname> <Virtual-Hostname.domain>

<IP-address> <Physical-Hostname> <Physical-Hostname.domain>

This simple adjustment ensures that the reverse lookup resolves the correct virtual hostname, allowing the SWPM process to continue without errors.

Thank you for reading. Please feel free to share your thoughts.

entry.title: Standard S/4HANA Approach for Leasing Account Determination Without Material or Service Master Data
entry.content:
Hi All,

Is there a standard way in SAP S/4HANA to derive a valuation class  and therefore the correct G/L account via OBYC , for leasing purchase orders without using a material master?

In our scenario, Procurement wants to create leasing POs using free-text or service (item category D) lines only. They do not want to create or duplicate material codes just to drive account determination. However, Finance requires that all leasing-related costs automatically post to a dedicated leasing G/L account for IFRS 16 reporting. This means we need a valuation class to be determined automatically in the PO, even though no material master is used.

Is there a standard S/4HANA configuration approach that allows: PO item category D (Service) No material number in the PO Automatic determination of valuation class based on something like material group Automatic G/L determination through OBYC (GBB/VBR) No enhancements, no BAdIs, no custom fields …essentially allowing Finance to get the correct leasing G/L while Procurement continues using text/service items?

If so, what configuration objects are involved, and are there specific dependencies (e.g., item category, account assignment category, plant, purchasing org) that must be maintained for this to work?”** what is tiltle of that?

entry.title: Re: Issue While Creating Purchase Order from PR – PO Form...
entry.content:
Good day @sai52 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some references for more details.

Adobe Document Services Configuration Guide, Adobe Rendering Error, Handling Errors and Problems

Based on your description, it might be due to inconsistent/invalid filed values that came from a specific PR. You can also see the message in your error message.

In your example it seems ADS encountered data that does not match the data binding expected by your custom form YY1_PO_FORM_G066. The systems seem to have received some missing fields from the CDS which are required. That might explain why it generated that error.

Check if your PO form references contain the same field in the PR, if not the Adobe XML has null elements and therefore breaks the form.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: tolerance set for supplier invoice amounts
entry.content:
Dear @ZZ3987,

What you’re seeing is actually the standard S/4HANA Cloud behavior:

The tolerance limit (5%) usually causes the invoice to be posted but blocked for payment – it does not automatically raise a hard error.

If you want the system to stop posting with an error once the tolerance is exceeded, you need to link that tolerance check to an error message and set that message to type E in configuration.

1. Maintain the tolerance in Set Tolerance Limits (SSCUI 101947).

More details:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3353780

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3052672

2. Identify the M8 message raised when the tolerance is exceeded.

3. In Define Message Types for Area M8 (SSCUI 102091), set that message to type E (Error).

More details:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3014673

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: 🕵️‍♂️ Something’s About to Happen in Barcelona…
Automating Training Assignments Using Integer Custom Fields
entry.content:
Background

For years, customers requested enhancements to assign training dynamically after hire or after completing another item. Below are some key requests:

Enhancement Requests

  • Allow training to be assigned X days after hire date
  • Automatic assignment after X days of completing Item A
  • Assign training via Assignment Profile X days after hire date

New Feature in 2H 2025

SAP introduced Integer and Decimal data types for custom fields in the User entity. This enables operators like Less Than or Equal To, Greater Than or Equal To, and Between for numeric criteria in Assignment Profiles.

Though this is not a perfect solution we can utilize for our requirement.

Step-by-Step Implementation

We will walk through an example: Assign onboarding course 15 days after joining for hires after 1st Jan 2025.

Configuration in LMS

Creating References

  • Create custom fields: Navigate to Learning Administration > System Administration > Custom Fields > User. Select data type as Integer and assign a unique field number (e.g., 170). 
  • Add new and you can select “data type” as Integer
  • For field number you can put any number except standard custom field numbers(10,20…150)
  • In this example I have used 170 ,you can enter any number you like.

Creating Integer Custom Field

Adding Configuration

  • Once created, you need to add the reference in connector configuration file so that your user connector will pick it up
  • To do that go to Learning Administration>System Administration>Configuration >System Configuration
    in this select Connector and add following line at bottom

Sample file

Sfuser.field.customcolumn.<your_column_number>=<your_column_name_in_connector_file>

For example I have created 2 columns below

#No of Years after hiring
Sfuser.field.customcolumn.160=YOE

#No of Day after hiring
Sfuser.field.customcolumn.170=DAH

If you do not want to touch your user data file or your user data file is coming from provisioning then you can use user extended data file
for that just modify the formula like this.

Sfuser.extendeduser.field.customcolumn.<your_column_number>=<your_column_name_in_connector_file>

Example -

Sfuser.extendeduser.field.customcolumn.160=YOE
Sfuser.extendeduser.field.customcolumn.170=DAH

Now the work in LMS is done for User connector part

Setting up Integration

If you do not have integration center job  for user connector  then you can go through following guide - SuccessFactors: Goodbye Provisioning Jobs Part 1 | Using Integration Center (IC) for synchronizing user data from Foundation to LMS via SF - User Connector 
I strongly recommend to move from Provisioning to IC job for User Connector for easy to access ,configure and debug.

Now you have Integration center job, you have to create new column for “Days After Hiring”
select Numeric value in Field Data Type
use following screenshot for reference


Days after hiring calculation

You can also add “Years after Hiring”


Years after hiring calculation

User the above settings for creating new Numeric columns and run/schedule your IC job

If you do not want to use user data file then you can use user extended data file
sample file you can see here(use the same blog listed above to create the file)
I have attached sample file for your reference

make sure you have used userid column as ^UserId
you can refer the IC job here

Years after hiring calculation

You are done with IC job, Sync this file using User Connector SF and head to Assignment Profile

creating Assignment Profiles

Due to new data type we have new operators specifically for Numerical values– “Less Than or Equal to”, “Greater Than or Equal to” and “Between”

New operators for Assignment Profile

Your Requirement – any user joined after 1st Jan 2025 ,should get assigned onboarding course after 15th day from Joining.

In Assignment Profile you can create the rule as follows

days rule

Similarly if you want to Assign based on Years of Experience then you can use this

years rule

Also you can use this with JOB Grades where you can use between feature to segregate the grades

between rule

This will eliminate manually selecting each job grade to add into the criteria and give you dynamic option.
I highly encourage to transform your Grades to Numeric values using lookup table in IC so that you can use it as Numeric values (example M1 =1,M2 = 2 etc)

Future cases

Similar to this if you are feeling motivated and adventurous then you can create PRD report which has an user and item completion date and calculation from date of completion

send this data to EC using MDF and use it to extract back to User connector, you have to create this for multiple items and use it to assign courses After completion/assignment of Item A > automatic assignment after X days of Item B

sample report data
userid,itemid,completiondate,today-completiondate
10001,abc123,10-11-2025,5

entry.title: Re: ECDHE encryption protocol in SQL Anywhere 17.0.10.5866 ?
entry.content:
I can't tell for that particular version, however the supported ciphers are documented:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_SQL_Anywhere/61ecb3d4d8be4baaa07cc4db0ddb5d0a/3bcc73636c5f1014842cdeb27af3fed0.html

You can also specify which minimal protocol version and what ciphers are to be used.
